deviceType.title: Device Type
deviceType.description: Defines the type of the device that the Netatmo Rain Sensor is exposed as in Homebridge. Both types can be triggers for automations. Leak Sensors additionally trigger a push notification in iOS though.

pollingInterval.title: Netatmo API polling interval
pollingInterval.description: Defines the interval used for polling the Netatmo API. Keep in mind that currently the Netatmo Rain Sensor is only updating the data on the API every 10 minutes. So the maximum lag for rain detection is currently 10 minutes plus this number of minutes. Also keep in mind that Netatmo might block your developer account if you poll too often. Therefore the minimum polling interval of 1 minute which should be safe.

slidingWindowSize.title: Sliding window size
slidingWindowSize.description: This interval defines the minimum time that a rain detection state will be active. Keep in mind that Netatmo accumulates Rain Sensor values to slices of 30 minutes. Therefore the values for this parameter are multiples of 30 minutes.

cooldownInterval.title: Cooldown interval
cooldownInterval.description: This interval defines the time after a rain detection in which no rain detection is triggered.

rainSensorSerial.title: Rain sensor serial number
rainSensorSerial.description: Serial number of rain sensor as shown in the Apple Home app e.g. g7257d3
